result.execSummary:
The defendant Francisco Pedrosa Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Maintain Sex Offender Registry, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence currently being served

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically sex offender treatment program. No contact with anyone under 18 years of age without agent approval. No contact with victims of prior offenses without agent approval and consent of victims. DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence currently being served

** AMENDED 10-13-17: Original sentence dated 06-06-16 is vacated. Def has been resentenced. **
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including sex offender treatment and follow through if not already done. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  No contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved by agent.   Defendant must register with the Sex Offender Registry and comply with all rules and requirements of the Sex Offender Registry.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
